trial_identification.studytitle: Influence of the Attention on the Posture Evaluation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Influence of the Attention on the Posture Evaluation in Healthy Participants measured by Photogrammetry

interventions.interventions: Pictures were taken in 3 situations on the same session: 1. with the attention deviated by a memory test without the volunteers knowing what was going on; 2. without the attention deviated and 3. with the attention deviated by the same memory test but now with the volunteers knowing the procedure. The pictures were then analysed by the Software of Postural Evaluation (SAPO). The memory test consisted of 10 cards in which there were a a line of different colored circles and they had to memorize the sequency of the colored circles for 15 seconds and them say the order of the colors without looking at the cards, one at a time. Three minutes after the memory test began the pictures were taken.
interventions.comparator: A person with the attention deviated unconsciously, conciously and without the attention deviated, using the Software of Postural Evaluation (SAPO) to evaluate postural changes. All patients underwent the same process

primaryOutcome.outcome: Picture taken with the attention deviated unconsciouly in the frontal plane and right profile plane by Photogrammetry using the Software of Postural Evaluation (SAPO) protocol
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After the third minute of the memory test the pictures were taken

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Picture taken whithout the attention deviated, using the standard protocol of the Software of Postural Evaluation (SAPO)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: After the voice command the pictures were taken

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Volunteers in the adult age and healthy
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: pain, musclesquelectical disorders, systemic disorders, neurological or psychological deseases and Hyperactive and Attention deficit disorder.

trial_design.designfeatures: There was neither an intervention group nor a control group. All the volunteers were done the same procedure. The differences between the 3 pictures that were taken into consideration
